results.byline: By Maggie Haberman, Jonah E. Bromwich and William K. Rashbaum
results.title: Trump, Escalating Attacks, Raises Specter of Violence if He Is Charged
results.abstract: In an overnight post, the former president warned of “potential death and destruction” if he was indicted. Hours later, the Manhattan district attorney’s office received a threatening letter.

media.caption: Former President Donald J. Trump, who is again campaigning for the White House, has called the investigation a politically motivated “witch hunt.”

results.adx_keywords: Real Estate and Housing (Residential);Affordable Housing;Homeless Persons;Taxation;High Net Worth Individuals;California;Los Angeles (Calif)
results.title: For Sale: Mansions in Los Angeles at Bargain Prices
results.abstract: Millionaire homeowners are trying to sell their houses before the city’s “mansion tax” goes into effect on April 1.

media.caption: Measure ULA, a transfer tax on big-ticket property sales in Los Angeles, goes into effect on April 1. The looming tax has sparked a frenzy in listings.

results.title: That Missing Trump Portrait? Found, Next to Some Old Yoga Mats.

results.title: A Refuge for Russians and Ukrainians, Bali Rethinks Its Open-Door Policy
results.abstract: After multiple accounts of tourists behaving badly, its governor wants Russia and Ukraine to lose access to Indonesia’s visa-on-arrival program.

results.title: A Million Bodies Are Buried Here. Now It’s Becoming a Park.
results.abstract: Hart Island, a potter’s field where New York City has buried its unclaimed dead for more than a century, will finally accept visitors this year.

media.caption: The city still conducts about 1,100 burials every year on Hart Island, adding to the million bodies already buried there. The graves will remain undisturbed as Hart Island is opened to the public.

results.title: U.S. and Canada Reach an Agreement on Diverting Asylum Seekers
